title: Violent clashes at 'Stop the Steal' clashes in Washington, DC
description: At least four people were stabbed Saturday night amid post-election protests in Washington, according to the DC Metropolitan Police Department's public affairs office.

title: Biden's Catholic faith will be on full display as the first publicly churchgoing president in decades
description: Joe Biden rarely misses Sunday Mass. So it was notable when the President-elect didn't attend church on November 29, the first Sunday of Advent and the beginning of the season when Roman Catholics like Biden prepare for Christmas.

title: US agencies investigating hacking of government networks
description: The US Commerce Department confirmed Sunday it has been the victim of a data breach.

title: Despite promises of solidarity, rich countries are snapping up the supply of vaccines
description: When 90-year-old Margaret Keenan received the world's first clinically authorized and tested Covid-19 vaccine earlier this week, the end of the Covid-19 pandemic seemed finally in reach.

title: Man climbs onto wing of airliner preparing to take off
description: A man was taken into custody after he climbed onto the wing of an Alaska Airlines plane at the Las Vegas airport Saturday, an airport spokesman said.

title: President Trump's first on-camera interview since the election
description: In an interview with Fox News, President Trump remained steadfast in his false claims of election fraud.

title: Trump engages in self-sabotage ahead of historic vaccine rollout
description: As doses of a coronavirus vaccine are being prepared to be shipped to communities across the United States, President Donald Trump has an opportunity to mark a historic milestone for science -- and show some semblance of leadership in curbing the spread of Covid-19 as the number of US cases crosses 16 million.

title: Timothée Chalamet and Pete Davidson mock Newsmax with a hilarious Jets sketch on 'SNL'
description: Disguised as passionate Jets fans, Timothée Chalamet and Pete Davidson mocked conservative news channel Newsmax on "Saturday Night Live" last night.

title: Elon Musk is leaving Silicon Valley for Texas. These millionaires and companies are joining him
description: Silicon Valley has been the epicenter of the tech industry for decades, starting in 1938 when Bill Hewlett and David Packard started tinkering in a Palo Alto garage.

title: US Covid-19 vaccinations expected to begin Monday as CDC head gives final nod
description: Vaccinations against Covid-19 can now begin in the United States.

title: Actress Carol Sutton dies of Covid-19 complications
description: Actress Carol Sutton died Friday at age 76 of Covid-19 complications, New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell said.

title: 'SNL' has fans throwing bras at their Dr. Fauci spoof
description: In the latest "Saturday Night Live" cold open skit, actors portraying Dr. Anthony Fauci and Dr. Deborah Birx get a surprise gift from audience members.

title: Anderson Cooper and Ina Garten discuss the joys of peanut butter and jelly
description: "I have the palette of a five year old," Anderson Cooper tells celebrity chef Ina Garten.

title: What it's like to travel to Hawaii right now
description: When Hawaii reopened after seven months of lockdown and mandatory quarantining on October 15, I booked my flight to the Island of Hawaii (also known as the "the Big Island"), the state's largest, most ecologically diverse island, with eight of 13 of the world's climate zones and a few active volcanoes.

title: Meet the Black cowgirl who inspires children to read
description: The only thing better than receiving a book is getting one delivered by a horse.

title: Georgia mom facing murder charges after stabbing her children, ages 5 and 6, police say
description: A Gainesville, Georgia, mother is facing murder charges after, investigators say, she fatally stabbed her 5- and 6-year-old children before turning the knife on herself.

title: Germany to go into a 'hard' national lockdown for just under a month
description: Germany will go into a "hard" national lockdown, starting next week and continuing through the Christmas period, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said Sunday, after agreeing to stricter measures with state governments to stem a wave of coronavirus cases.

title: CNN's Jake Tapper wants to thank Trump. Hear his message
description: CNN's Jake Tapper lists the ways in which President Donald Trump's presidency helped bring to light issues with our political system.

title: Bill Gates warns next 4 to 6 months could be worst of the pandemic
description: Bill Gates talks with CNN's Jake Tapper about the US response to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Bill Gates: Presidential transition is complicating vaccine efforts
description: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, whose foundation has been part of the effort to develop and deliver Covid-19 vaccines, said the presidential transition is "complicating" efforts to distribute one.

title: The real cost of being the ultimate Apple fan: Nearly $80,000
description: Picture this: You are the ultimate Apple fan. You've got an unlimited budget. And you want all of the things: top-of-the-line devices, fancy accessories and services.

title: UK and EU agree to keep talking past deadline as 'no-deal Brexit' looms large
description: The United Kingdom and the European Union have agreed -- once again -- to extend trade talks beyond a self-imposed deadline after failing to reach a compromise, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Sunday.

title: This writer found an old typewriter and rekindled a traditional way of easing isolation just in time for the holidays
description: When New Yorker staff writer Rachel Syme bought an old-school typewriter, she thought it might be fun to send friends and family letters they could hold in their hands.

title: Students missing after gunmen attack school
description: Hassan Abdul-Bashir was in bed in his dorm in Kankara, Nigeria when the gunshots started on Friday night. The 13-year-old was ordered outside, where gunmen were ushering everyone towards the school's gates. That's when he decided to run. He took cover under a faulty school bus, then ran to the school's fence and hid there.

title: 'SNL' brings out its own Dr. Fauci
description: "Saturday Night Live" kicked off its latest episode with its own Dr. Anthony Fauci and Dr. Deborah Birx, who were trying to talk about the coronavirus vaccine while Fauci got hit in the face with women's bras.

title: The son of an Iraq War veteran designed an app to stop his dad's PTSD nightmares
description: When US Army veteran Patrick Skluzacek returned from Iraq in the mid-2000s, life was good -- every day was another welcome home party, he had a paid month off work, and he was finally back with family.

title: Two North Atlantic right whale newborns have been spotted off the US coast
description: The year is ending on a positive note for North Atlantic right whales, a critically endangered species, with the spotting of two newborn calves.

title: FedEx exec shows off 'guardian angel' tracking technology
description: With shipments of the coronavirus vaccine expected to roll out Sunday, Richard Smith, Regional President of the Americas and Executive Vice President at FedEx, reveals how the company will track such precious cargo.

title: LEGO won't make modern war machines, but others are picking up the pieces
description: This is a story about a multibillion-dollar international conglomerate, arms manufacturers, a German peace group and renegades who make miniaturized weapons systems out of small shops.
